Class LinkedListMegaBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • LinkedListMegaBlock

  • public class LinkedListMegaBlock
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models and implements a linked list of MegaBlock objects

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LinkedListMegaBlock()
      Creates an empty linked list of mega blocks

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBlue(MegaBlock blueBlock)
      Adds a blueBlock at the end of this list
      void addRed(MegaBlock redBlock)
      Adds a new object at the head of this list
      void addYellow(int index, MegaBlock yellowBlock)
      Adds the provided yellowBlock at the position index in this list
      void clear()
      Removes all of the elements from this list.
      MegaBlock get(int index)
      Returns the element stored at position index of this list without removing it.
      int getBlueCount()
      Returns the number of blue mega bloks stored in this list
      int getRedCount()
      Returns the number of red mega bloks stored in this list
      int getYellowCount()
      Returns the number of yellow mega bloks stored in this list
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this list contains no elements.
      MegaBlock removeBlue()
      Removes and returns the element at the tail of this list if it has a blue color
      MegaBlock removeRed()
      Removes and returns the mega block at the head of this list if its color is red
      MegaBlock removeYellow(int index)
      Removes and returns the element stored at index position in this list
      MegaBlock set(int index, MegaBlock block)
      Replaces the megablock at the specified position in this list with the specified element if they have the same Color
      int size()
      Returns the size of this list
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the contents of this list

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LinkedListMegaBlock

        public LinkedListMegaBlock()
        Creates an empty linked list of mega blocks

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this list contains no elements.
        Returns:
        true if this list is empty, and false otherwise.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the size of this list
        Returns:
        the number of megablocks stored in this list

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all of the elements from this list. The list will be empty after this call returns.

      • addBlue

        public void addBlue(MegaBlock blueBlock)
        Adds a blueBlock at the end of this list
        Parameters:
        blueBlock - new element to be added to this list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if blueBlock is null or if the color of the specific blueBlock is not equal to Color.BLUE

      • addRed

        public void addRed(MegaBlock redBlock)
        Adds a new object at the head of this list
        Parameters:
        redBlock - new element to be added to this list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if redBlock is null or if its color does not equal to Color.RED

      • addYellow

        public void addYellow(int index,
                      MegaBlock yellowBlock)
        Adds the provided yellowBlock at the position index in this list
        Parameters:
        index - index at which the specified yellow block is to be inserted
        yellowBlock - new element to be added to this list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if yellowBlock is null or if it does not have a Color.YELLOW color
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of the range reserved for yellow blocks (index < redCount || index > size - blueCount)

      • get

        public MegaBlock get(int index)
        Returns the element stored at position index of this list without removing it.
        Parameters:
        index - position within this list
        Returns:
        the megablock object stored at position index of this list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • set

        public MegaBlock set(int index,
                     MegaBlock block)
        Replaces the megablock at the specified position in this list with the specified element if they have the same Color
        Parameters:
        index - index of the block to replace
        block - element to be stored at the specified position
        Returns:
        the element previously at the specified position
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if object is null or is not equal to the megablock already at at index position
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • removeRed

        public MegaBlock removeRed()
        Removes and returns the mega block at the head of this list if its color is red
        Returns:
        a reference to the removed element
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if this list does not contain any red mega block

      • removeBlue

        public MegaBlock removeBlue()
        Removes and returns the element at the tail of this list if it has a blue color
        Returns:
        a reference to the removed element
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if this list does not contain any blue block

      • removeYellow

        public MegaBlock removeYellow(int index)
        Removes and returns the element stored at index position in this list
        Parameters:
        index - position of the element to remove in this list
        Returns:
        a reference to the removed element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < redCount or index >= size - blueCount)

      • getRedCount

        public int getRedCount()
        Returns the number of red mega bloks stored in this list
        Returns:
        the redCount

      • getYellowCount

        public int getYellowCount()
        Returns the number of yellow mega bloks stored in this list
        Returns:
        the yellowCount

      • getBlueCount

        public int getBlueCount()
        Returns the number of blue mega bloks stored in this list
        Returns:
        the blueCount

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the contents of this list
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        return a String representation of the content of this list. If this list is empty, an empty String ("") will be returned.
